message.content:
cs.NI, cs.DC, cs.DS, cs.SE, cs.CR 

This paper is likely to belong to the Computer Science sub-category of Network and Internet Architecture (cs.NI) as it presents a novel peer-to-peer architecture specifically designed for developing IoT applications over heterogeneous networks. It also discusses distributed and fault-tolerant resource discovery, transparent routing over subnetworks, and application protocol independence from the transport protocol in narrowband Wireless Sensor Networks. 

It could also belong to the Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing (cs.DC) sub-category as it presents a distributed architecture for IoT applications. 

The paper also discusses the design challenges and presents a comparative experimental performance assessment, which could make it relevant to the Data Structures and Algorithms (cs.DS) and Software Engineering (cs.SE) sub-categories. 

Finally, the paper presents a security mechanism for peer groups, which could make it relevant to the Cryptography and Security (cs.CR) sub-category.
